definition: court lady/palace maid/traditional painting of beautiful women
to serve as an official/an official/the two chess pieces in Chinese chess guarding the "general" or "king" 將|将[jiang4]

sentences.english: Tang Dynasty is a Golden Age of the traditional Chinese Painting of beautiful women.
sentences.chinese: 唐代是中國傳統仕女畫的黃金時期。

sentences.english: Knit, the women beat the umbrella son stroll rain in.
sentences.chinese: 織，仕女打着傘兒漫步雨中。

sentences.english: Is currently the only recognized worldwide tang handed down only existing copy of seeing painting.
sentences.chinese: 是目前全世界範圍內唯一認定的唐代仕女畫傳世孤本。

sentences.english: The painting of beautiful women was another field of portraiture.
sentences.chinese: 人物畫中的另一個領域是仕女畫。

sentences.english: Ladies draw in the Ming Dynasty is a very important but the lack of an overall study area.
sentences.chinese: 明代仕女畫是一個很重要但又缺乏整體研究的領域。

sentences.english: The painting of noble woman experienced an endless history stage but develop gradually with perfect.
sentences.chinese: 仕女畫經歷了漫長的歷史階段而逐步發展和完善。

sentences.english: Knit, the women blow the umbrella son stroll rain in.
sentences.chinese: 織，仕女打着傘兒漫步雨中。

sentences.english: However, in the Tang Dynasty, the paintings of beautiful women appeared as an independent type of painting.
sentences.chinese: 在唐代，仕女畫是作爲一個專門的畫科而出現的。

sentences.english: The elegant posture of the lady echoes the form of Chinese blue and white ceramics.
sentences.chinese: 而仕女的坐姿又和背景的青瓷花瓶的形態互相呼應。

definition: Gu Kaizhi or Ku K'aichih (346-407), famous painter of Eastern Jin dynasty, one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家
gongbi, traditional Chinese painting method characterized by meticulous brush technique and detailed description
accurate depiction of architectural forms with the aid of a ruler (technique of Chinese art)/picture created using this technique
Giuseppe Castiglione (1688-1766) Jesuit who served as Qing court painter for 50 years
